intro: Galarhoeus semivillosus, commonly known as the velvetleaf galarhoeus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to cream-colored flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
